intro: Primulina longgangensis var. hongyao, commonly known as the Hongyao primulina, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its unique foliage and vibrant floral display. The plant typically features dark green, velvety leaves with striking red or purple veins, which contribute to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
